task.title: Linking to a Workspace
task.shortdesc: Use these steps to link to a workspace that has been targeted from the current Navigator item or view.

context.p: Many monitoring agent products have workspace links available through their predefined workspaces. You can also create and use links to workspaces that follow a logical progression of investigation into performance and operation issues.

step.cmd: Open the workspace from where you will launch the link to open the source workspace.
Do one of the following, depending on where the link originates:

choices.choice: Click the link indicator on a table row or the graphic view, then skip to step 4. A dimmed link indicator means the link is not available from that row.
Right-click a pie chart slice, bar chart bar, plot chart point, table row, graphic view icon, or TMS Infrastructure object.

step.cmd: Click Link To and click the target workspace in the list.
step.info: The target filter or link expression is used to select the information displayed in the views of the target workspace. If, instead of the workspace opening, you get a Target not found message, the definition of the target workspace could not be resolved.

step.note: If there is more than one workspace you can link to, the Select Target window opens.
step.cmd: Select the Navigator item for the workspace and click OK.
Click OK if a message asks you to select a leaf node, then select an item deeper in the tree hierarchy.

taskbody.result:
The target workspace is displayed. If the link was defined to open the workspace in a new window, it is opened in its own window. If you are using the browser client and your browser supports tabs, the workspace is in a new tab next to the source workspace.Navigation using and
to visited workspaces retains the link context. As an example, consider a link to a workspace from a table row. The row from which you linked is remembered when you revisit the target workspace.
